title: [BUG] Can't gc a run with Postgres and S3 artifact-serving

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [X] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### MLflow version

- Client: 2.0.1
- Tracking server: 2.0.1

### System information

- Debian Buster Slim 10.13
- Python 3.8.14



### Describe the problem

Performing a `mlflow gc` fails to delete artifacts when the backend store is a Postgres database and the artifact store is S3.

### Tracking information

Logged from a client notebook

```
MLflow version: 2.0.1
Tracking URI: http://mlflow.domino-platform:5000/
Artifact URI: mlflow-artifacts:/1/0236553fa57241c2a08e18870a3556a1/artifacts
System information: Linux #1 SMP Wed Nov 2 17:44:17 UTC 2022
Python version: 3.9.15
MLflow version: 2.0.1
MLflow module location: /opt/conda/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/__init__.py
Tracking URI: http://mlflow.domino-platform:5000/
Registry URI: http://mlflow.domino-platform:5000/
Active experiment ID: 1
Active run ID: 0236553fa57241c2a08e18870a3556a1
Active run artifact URI: mlflow-artifacts:/1/0236553fa57241c2a08e18870a3556a1/artifacts
MLflow environment variables: {
    "MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI": "http://mlflow.domino-platform:5000/",
    "MLFLOW_TRACKING_TOKEN": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..wl49DmPEf8_4Wp4ZTYbuBLUg9hvUmhfmW_C6gT2ShEc"
}
MLflow dependencies: {
    "click": "8.1.3",
    "cloudpickle": "2.2.0",
    "databricks-cli": "0.17.4",
    "entrypoints": "0.4",
    "gitpython": "3.1.29",
    "pyyaml": "6.0",
    "protobuf": "4.21.12",
    "pytz": "2022.6",
    "requests": "2.28.1",
    "packaging": "22.0",
    "importlib-metadata": "5.1.0",
    "sqlparse": "0.4.3",
    "alembic": "1.9.0",
    "docker": "6.0.1",
    "Flask": "2.2.2",
    "numpy": "1.23.3",
    "scipy": "1.9.2",
    "pandas": "1.5.0",
    "querystring-parser": "1.2.4",
    "sqlalchemy": "1.4.45",
    "scikit-learn": "1.1.2",
    "pyarrow": "8.0.0",
    "shap": "0.41.0",
    "markdown": "3.4.1",
    "matplotlib": "3.6.2",
    "gunicorn": "20.1.0",
    "Jinja2": "3.1.2"
}
```


### Code to reproduce issue

Setup tracking server with proxied artifact access (storing in S3) and a Postgres database for experiment / run storage.

Assuming the following archived run with an artifact:

> mlflow runs describe --run-id ee7b8172bf9742a0943205672682243d

```
{
    "info": {
        "artifact_uri": "mlflow-artifacts:/1/ee7b8172bf9742a0943205672682243d/artifacts",
        "end_time": 1671067796774,
        "experiment_id": "1",
        "lifecycle_stage": "deleted",
        "run_id": "ee7b8172bf9742a0943205672682243d",
        "run_name": "crawling-cow-833",
        "run_uuid": "ee7b8172bf9742a0943205672682243d",
        "start_time": 1671067734932,
        "status": "FAILED",
        "user_id": "ubuntu"
    },
    "data": {
        "metrics": {
            "foo": 1.0
        },
        "params": {
            "default": "0.2"
        },
        "tags": {
            "mlflow.source.type": "NOTEBOOK",
            "mlflow.user": "integration-test",
            "mlflow.source.name": "/opt/conda/lib/python3.9/site-packages/ipykernel_launcher.py",
            "mlflow.runName": "crawling-cow-833"
        }
    }
}
```

> mlflow artifacts list --run-id ee7b8172bf9742a0943205672682243d

```
[{
  "path": "requirements_apps.txt",
  "is_dir": false,
  "file_size": 1014
}]
```

> mlflow artifacts download --run-id ee7b8172bf9742a0943205672682243d -a requirements_apps.txt

```
/tmp/tmpm39f2uuw/requirements_apps.txt
```

> cat /tmp/tmpm39f2uuw/requirements_apps.txt

```
# Requirements for the Python/Flask app publishing example.
flask>=1.0

# Requirements for the Python/Dash app publishing example.
dash~=0.21.0
dash-core-components~=0.21.1
dash-html-components~=0.9.0
dash-renderer~=0.12.1
dash-table-experiments~=0.6.0
```


> mlflow gc --backend-store-uri postgresql://postgres:${SECRET_PASSWORD}@mlflow-postgresql:5432/mlflow --run-ids ee7b8172bf9742a0943205672682243d

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/mlflow", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(cli())
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1130, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1055, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1657, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1404, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 760, in invoke
    return __callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/cli.py", line 459, in gc
    backend_store = _get_store(backend_store_uri, None)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/utils.py", line 188, in _get_store
    return _tracking_store_registry.get_store(store_uri, artifact_uri)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/registry.py", line 39, in get_store
    return self._get_store_with_resolved_uri(resolved_store_uri, artifact_uri)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/registry.py", line 49, in _get_store_with_resolved_uri
    return builder(store_uri=resolved_store_uri, artifact_uri=artifact_uri)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/utils.py", line 149, in _get_sqlalchemy_store
    return SqlAlchemyStore(store_uri, artifact_uri)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py", line 153, in __init__
    mkdir(local_file_uri_to_path(default_artifact_root))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py", line 120, in mkdir
    raise e
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py", line 117, in mkdir
    os.makedirs(target)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/os.py", line 223, in makedirs
    mkdir(name, mode)
PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: './mlruns'
```


### Stack trace

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/mlflow", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(cli())
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1130, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1055, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1657, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1404, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 760, in invoke
    return __callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/cli.py", line 459, in gc
    backend_store = _get_store(backend_store_uri, None)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/utils.py", line 188, in _get_store
    return _tracking_store_registry.get_store(store_uri, artifact_uri)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/registry.py", line 39, in get_store
    return self._get_store_with_resolved_uri(resolved_store_uri, artifact_uri)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/registry.py", line 49, in _get_store_with_resolved_uri
    return builder(store_uri=resolved_store_uri, artifact_uri=artifact_uri)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/utils.py", line 149, in _get_sqlalchemy_store
    return SqlAlchemyStore(store_uri, artifact_uri)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py", line 153, in __init__
    mkdir(local_file_uri_to_path(default_artifact_root))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py", line 120, in mkdir
    raise e
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py", line 117, in mkdir
    os.makedirs(target)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/os.py", line 223, in makedirs
    mkdir(name, mode)
PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: './mlruns'
```

### Other info / logs

I made sure that the environment had all the MLFLOW env vars configured (so that the CLI might better understand artifacts storage configuration) -- that made no impact on the result. 

I don't think `gc` uses APIs from the tracking server, so it seems to me that `gc` should support a `--default-artifact-root` cli switch to go along  with `--backend-store-uri`

### What component(s) does this bug affect?

- [X] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/recipes`: Recipes, Recipe APIs, Recipe configs, Recipe Templates
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [X] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

### What interface(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

### What language(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

### What integration(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
